thread.section_title: ABC7 News and Weather - Southwest Florida News
thread.title: Widespread rain brings potential for flooding in SWFL
thread.title_full: Widespread rain brings potential for flooding in SWFL

author: Meteorologist Sami Squires
title: Widespread rain brings potential for flooding in SWFL
text: Widespread rain brings potential for flooding in SWFL Flood Watch issued for Collier County starting Friday morning. Flood Watch issued for Collier County starting Friday morning. Flood Watch issued for Collier County starting Friday morning. A Flood Watch has been issued for Collier County starting Friday morning. A strong system is anticipated to bring widespread rain Friday and last through portions of Saturday. Clouds are increasing on Thursday ahead of the storms. While isolated showers are in the forecast for Thursday evening, steadier rain will arrive Friday morning before sunrise. DOWNLOAD the [ABC7 News app](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=109350X1567044&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.flowcode.com%2Fpage%2Fabc7-news-app&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.abc-7.com%2Farticle%2Fwidespread-rain-brings-potential-for-flooding-in-swfl%2F60270239&xcust=undefined) for the latest weather updates and alerts. Waves of heavier rain will move through Southwest Florida throughout the afternoon and evening with gusty winds. A cold front will move towards Southwest Florida overnight, bringing the chance for isolated severe storms. We will continue to see on-and-off storms overnight into Saturday morning before the cold front passes. By Saturday evening, rainfall amounts will be around 1-3 inches in Charlotte, DeSoto, Glades, Hendry, and Lee counties. More: [What to do if you're in your car caught in flood waters](https://www.nbc-2.com/article/what-to-do-if-youre-in-your-car-caught-in-flood-waters/46635443) A Flood Watch was issued across portions of South Florida, including Collier County, where rain totals are anticipated to be around 3-5 inches, with locally heavier amounts possible. If you encounter a flooded road, turn around. Just because the road is still open, doesn't mean your car won't get stuck. Things will start to clear out late in the day on Saturday. Highs will be in the mid-70s on Friday and near 80 on Saturday. Sunday will be a much nicer day with drier air and plenty of sunshine!
